Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அழுக்கா றுடையான்கண் ஆக்கம்போன்று இல்லைஒழுக்க மிலான்கண் உயர்வு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Just as the envious man will be without wealth, so will the man of destitute of propriety of conduct be without greatness.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition illustrating a parallel.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the left, an envious man ('அழுக்காறு உடையான்') is shown. Because of his envy, wealth ('ஆக்கம்') is depicted as actively fleeing from him, as if repelled by his nature.
Layered_Composition.Background: On the right, a man who lacks good conduct ('ஒழுக்கம் இலான்') is shown. In the same way, greatness or high-status ('உயர்வு'), personified as a noble, radiant crown, is shown actively flying away from his head, refusing to rest upon him.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A direct analogy: just as wealth will not stay with an envious man, greatness will not stay with a man who lacks good conduct.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The personification of Wealth and Greatness as active agents that choose to flee from the unworthy is the key. This shows their absence not as a passive lack, but as an active rejection by the virtues themselves.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The envious man is in a sickly green light. The man of bad conduct is in a dull, chaotic light. Both the fleeing wealth and the fleeing crown are made of a pure, golden light that is escaping their corrupting presence.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A balanced diptych shot that shows the two parallel scenes of rejection.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with dynamic motion effects for the fleeing wealth and crown.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The light is shown actively leaving the unworthy subjects, plunging them into shadow.
